meanings.definition: The act of improvising or performing without preparation.
meanings.sent1: Her extemporization during the play was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's extemporization on stage had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent3: The extemporization of the chef in the kitchen led to a delicious new dish.
meanings.sent4: His extemporization on the guitar was like a beautiful dance of notes.
meanings.sent5: The extemporization of the speaker made the event unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Something improvised or performed without preparation.
meanings.sent1: The painting was an extemporization of colors and shapes.
meanings.sent2: The speech was a brilliant extemporization that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The extemporization of the magician left everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: The extemporization of the actor brought the character to life in a unique way.
meanings.sent5: Her extemporization of the song made it sound fresh and exciting.
